verses.text: 我在基督裡說的是實話，並沒有撒謊，因為我的良心在聖靈裡一同為我作證；

words.note: Often used after '在' to indicate location.
'的' nominalizes the preceding phrase.
Used to emphasize a negation, '並沒有'.
Often used after '在' to indicate location.

verses.text: 我大大憂愁，心裡常常傷痛。

words.note: Reduplication of '大' emphasizes degree.
Reduplication of '常' emphasizes frequency.

verses.text: 為我的同胞，就是我骨肉之親，就算自己受咒詛，與基督隔絕，我也甘心。

words.note: A classical idiom meaning close relatives.
Often indicates a passive action, '受X' = 'to be X-ed'.

verses.text: 他們是以色列人：嗣子的名分、榮耀、眾約、律法、敬拜的禮儀和各樣的應許，都是他們的。

words.note: Refers to the status of being a son/heir, often by adoption.
Refers to a specific title or share in something.

verses.text: 蒙揀選的列祖也是他們的祖宗；按肉身來說，基督也是出自他們這一族。其實，他是在萬有之上，永遠受稱頌的 神。阿們。

words.note: Often functions as a passive marker, '蒙X' means 'to be X-ed'.
Refers to a line of ancestors, especially prominent ones.
Used to introduce a perspective: '按X來說' = 'speaking from X's perspective'.
Often used before a measure word or noun for emphasis, 'this one X'.
Classical way to say 'above X'.
Often indicates a passive action, '受X' means 'to be X-ed'.
Capitalized when referring to the Christian God.

verses.text: 當然，這不是說 神的話落了空，因為出自以色列的，不都是以色列人；

words.note: The elevated character indicates reverence for God.
Refers to God's word being ineffective or unfulfilled.

verses.text: 也不因為他們是亞伯拉罕的後裔，就都成為他的兒女，只有「以撒生的，才可以稱為你的後裔」，
這就是說，肉身生的兒女並不是 神的兒女，只有憑著應許生的兒女才算是後裔。

words.note: In biblical context, 'flesh' often denotes the natural human state.
The elevated character indicates reverence for God.
Often refers to a divine promise in scripture.

verses.text: 因為所應許的話是這樣：「明年這個時候我要來，撒拉必定生一個兒子。」

words.note: Indicates the following verb is the object of a preceding action.
Often refers to a divine promise in scripture.

verses.text: 不但如此，利百加也是這樣：既然從一個人，就是從我們的祖宗以撒懷了孕，
雙生子還沒有生下來，善惡也沒有行出來（為要堅定 神揀選人的旨意，
不是由於行為，而是由於那呼召者）， 神就對她說：「將來大的要服事小的。」

words.note: Refers to God in this context.
The preceding space is a common honorific in Chinese Bibles.
Forms 'the elder one' with '大'.
More formal than 一般的 '服務'.
Forms 'the younger one' with '小'.

verses.text: 正如經上所記的：「我愛雅各，卻惡以掃。」

words.note: Forms 'that which is written' with '所記'.
Classical Chinese usage of '惡' as a verb meaning 'to hate'.

verses.text: 既是這樣，我們可以說甚麼呢？ 神不公平嗎？絕對不會！

words.definition: since it is, as it is

words.note: The preceding space is a common honorific in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 因為他對摩西說：「我要憐憫誰，就憐憫誰；我要恩待誰，就恩待誰。」

words.definition: show favor to, be gracious to
show favor to, be gracious to

verses.text: 這樣看來，既不是出於人意，也不是由於人為（「人為」原文作「奔走」或「奔跑」），只在於那憐憫人的 神。

words.note: Idiomatic expression.
Part of 既...也... (neither...nor) structure.
The space often indicates reverence for God in biblical texts.

verses.text: 經上有話對法老說：「我把你興起來，是要藉著你顯出我的大能，並且使我的名傳遍全地。」

words.note: Refers to written scripture.

words.definition: to raise up, cause to rise

words.note: Indicates direction or result after a verb.

words.definition: to want, to be going to

verses.text: 這樣看來，他願意憐憫誰就憐憫誰，願意誰剛硬就使誰剛硬。

words.note: Idiomatic expression.
Indicates a consequence or immediate result.
Often refers to hardening one's heart or will.
Indicates a consequence or immediate result.
Often refers to hardening one's heart or will.

verses.text: 神顯出忿怒又施行憐憫這樣，你會對我說：「那麼他為甚麼責怪人呢？有誰抗拒他的旨意呢？」

words.note: The space often indicates reverence for God in biblical texts.

verses.text: 你這個人哪，你是誰，竟敢跟 神頂嘴呢？被造的怎麼可以對造他的說：「你為甚麼把我做成這個樣子呢？」

words.note: The space often indicates reverence for God in biblical texts.
Verb-object compound: to 'butt heads' with mouth.
Here, '被造的' means 'the one created'.
Here, '造他的' means 'the one who created him'.
Indicates forming something into a specific result.

verses.text: 陶匠難道沒有權用同一團的泥，又做貴重的、又做卑賤的器皿嗎？

words.note: Used to express rhetorical questions implying a negative answer.
Often used in religious context for humility or low status.
Common metaphor for people in the Bible.

verses.text: 如果 神有意要顯明他的忿怒，彰顯他的大能，而多多容忍那可怒、預備遭毀滅的器皿，

words.note: Similar to 顯明 but often implies a grander, more public display.
Often used for God's omnipotence.
Reduplication for emphasis.
Literally 'worthy of anger'.
Often implies encountering something negative.

verses.text: 為了要使他豐盛的榮耀，彰顯在那蒙恩、早已預備要得榮耀的器皿上，這又有甚麼不可呢？

words.note: A common Christian term for being blessed by God's grace.

verses.text: 這器皿就是我們這些不但從猶太人中，也從外族人中蒙召的人。

words.note: Literally 'outsider people/ethnic group'.
Refers to being called or chosen by God.

verses.text: 就如 神在何西阿書上說的：「我要稱那不是我子民的為我的子民，那不蒙愛的為蒙愛的；

words.note: Used as a locative suffix indicating 'in' or 'on'.
Often used for God's chosen people.
Refers to being loved by God.

verses.text: 從前在甚麼地方對他們說：你們不是我的子民，將來就在那裡稱他們為永活 神的兒子。」

words.note: Refers to a specific group of people, often God's chosen people.
A common biblical descriptor for God.
Capitalized as a proper noun for God in Christian contexts.

verses.text: 以賽亞指著以色列人大聲說：「以色列子孫的數目雖然多如海沙，得救的不過是剩下的餘數；

words.note: Refers to the people of Israel.
A common biblical metaphor for a great number.
A core concept in Christianity.
Theologically significant, referring to those preserved by God.

verses.text: 因為主必在地上迅速而徹底地成就他的話。」

words.note: A title for God or Jesus in Christian texts.

verses.text: 又如以賽亞早已說過的：「如果不是萬軍之主給我們存留後裔，我們早就像所多瑪和蛾摩拉一樣了。」

words.note: Refers to heavenly armies or God's power.
Part of the title 'Lord of Hosts'.
Often used in biblical contexts regarding God preserving a remnant.

verses.text: 既是這樣，我們還有甚麼可說的呢？那不追求義的外族人卻得了義，就是因信而得的義。

words.note: A central concept in biblical ethics and theology.
Biblical term for non-Jewish people.
A fundamental concept in Christian theology, referring to justification by faith.

verses.heading: Israel’s Rejection Culpable

verses.text: 但以色列人追求律法的義（「律法的義」原文作「義的律法」），卻達不到律法的要求。

words.note: Refers to Mosaic Law or a spiritual principle.
Often refers to divine righteousness or justice in biblical contexts.
Verb-negative-complement structure.
Refers to Mosaic Law or a spiritual principle.

verses.text: 這是甚麼緣故呢？因為他們不憑信心，只靠行為。他們絆倒在那絆腳石上，

words.note: Often used for religious faith.
In theological context, refers to 'works of the law'.
Lit. 'trip-foot-stone', often used metaphorically in the Bible.
Used as a locative suffix.

verses.text: 正如經上所記：「看哪，我在錫安放了一塊絆腳石，是絆倒人的磐石；信靠他的人，必不致失望。」

words.note: Indicates the following verb is acted upon or a result.
An exclamation drawing attention, common in biblical texts.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Measure word for pieces, lumps, or chunks.
Lit. 'trip-foot-stone', often used metaphorically in the Bible.
Often used metaphorically for a firm foundation or refuge in the Bible.
Stronger than 'believe', implying active reliance.
Lit. 'lose hope'.
